About: *Sorry! Scratch Day at MIT is sold out, but you can still attend local Scratch Days in your area or organize your own.*
Join the Scratch Team on May 9th at the MIT Media Lab to meet, share, learn, and celebrate Scratch Day with local Scratchers!

Doors will open at 9am for registration, and festivities will run from 10am to 1pm. After an opening ceremony, children and families can choose from a variety of activities, including Getting Started with Scratch, Hip Hop Scratch Dance Party, Scratch Press, MaKey MaKey musical instruments, Sprite face painting, Extending Scratch, and more!

All ages are welcome, from newcomers to experienced Scratchers. All participants will have a chance to learn more about Scratch, share projects, and provide feedback to the Scratch Team. Younger children can join a ScratchJr workshop. Parents and educators are encouraged to participate in activities and join discussions about Scratch.
We can’t wait to celebrate Scratch Day with you on Saturday, May 9th!
Host_info: Scratch is designed and developed by the Lifelong Kindergarten Group (LLK) at the MIT Media Lab. Scratch Day at MIT is hosted and run by members of the Scratch Team, LLK, and local friends of Scratch.
Organization: The Scratch Team at the MIT Media Lab

Event: Create and Share with Scratch Programming
About: Scratch is an authoring environment that makes it easy for people to create their own interactive stories, games, animations, and simulations – and share their work with other creators in an online community. Scratch Day is a worldwide network of gatherings designed to bring the people in this online community together to meet, share, and learn with Scratch.

Students (Grades 3-8), teachers, and parents who are new to Scratch or have been using Scratch awhile are welcome to participate in this event. Students must be accompanied by a sponsoring teacher or adult. Sponsoring adults may bring up to 3 students. (Depending on the age of the students, this number could be adjusted by contacting anicholson2869@gmail.com )
If possible, please bring your own Mac or PC laptop (no tablets or mobile devices). We will have some laptops available for use.
Participants must pre-register. Attendance is limited to 50 participants.
Plans: During this event, participants will have the opportunity to: Join the Scratch community (free)
Learn about the Scratch online interface and how to create a project
Explore a variety of Scratch projects

About: Scratch is a computer programming language created by MIT's Lifelong Kindergarten group. Using Scratch, programmers (scratchers) can create animations, videos, games and almost anything that can be created by higher level programming languages. Scratch is designed with learning and education in mind. As young people create and share projects in Scratch, they develop important design and problem-solving skills, learning how to think creatively, reason systematically, and work collaboratively.

Scratch can be used in many different settings: schools, museums, community centers, and homes. It is intended especially for 8- to 16-year-olds, but younger children can work on Scratch projects with their parents or older siblings, and college students use Scratch in some introductory computer science classes. For more information visit the official site at scratch.mit.edu
Plans: 9:30 - Meet and greet as scrathers (students) and parents arrive

10:30 - Break Out Session 1 - Programming Teams begin working on a programming challenge. All teams will be presented with the same programming challenge. Students will create a story board of their program, gather the characters (they can be imported images or original creations) and start to program. 12:15 - Lunch - will be provided

1:00 - Break Out Session 2 - here teams will continue to create their solutions to the challenge, write the scripts, and create the program. For those who finish we will have a secondary challenge for them to solve.
2:30 - Closing Ceremony - To end the event students and parents will meet in a final assembly to celebrate the work created through demonstrations and special recognitions

Sammen med APP Academy og i forbindelse med den Internationale Scratch Dag, Lørdag d. 16. maj, arrangerer Nicolai for Børn programmerings workshop for børn fra 1.-5. klasse og deres  forældre.

Bliv introduceret til det webbaserede programmeringsværktøj Scratch, der ved hjælp af enkle byggeklodser bruges til at designe en virtuel historie eller et spil. I løbet af dagen får I mulighed for selv at designe jeres spil, og I får værktøjer med hjem til at kunne fortsætte produktionen i jeres egen stue!
Workshoppen henvender sig til både børn og deres forældre, så I sammen kan lege med den fascinerende programmeringsverden, og få et indblik i hvilke muligheder den rummer.
De færdige spil kan blandt andet deles på nettet via f.eks. Facebook eller andre sociale medier, så venner og familie også kan få lov at prøve.
Tag din computer med - vi sørger for lidt at spise og en forfriskning undervejs.
Der er begrænset antal pladser til workshoppen, så skynd dig at tilmelde dig!
Skriv en mail med navn, adresse, telefon nummer samt hvor mange børn/voksne I kommer og send den til nfb@kolding.dk

About: Celebrate Scratch Day with Nucleus Learning Network. Join this free beginner workshop geared to pairs of adults and children (for children 7 years old and up). Bring your own laptop and get introduced to Scratch. No experience necessary! Adults are expected to stay with children and learn along with the whole class. This class is for beginners with little to no experience with Scratch or computer programming. We will be creating a simple animation and introduce you to the world of Scratch.
RSVP Required: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/austin-scratch-day-family-workshop-tickets-16282337911
FAQs
Who is this workshop for?

We are inviting children and adults to register together in pairs. Children must be at least 7 years old. No child or adult programming experience required. This is for beginning Scratchers; will be covering Scratch basics. Adults are expected to stay and work along side their children - this is not a drop-off class!
What do I need to bring?

Participants need to bring one laptop per pair of adult/child participants.  Laptops must be wi-fi enabled, or have the Scratch Desktop Version installed in advance of the workshop: https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch2download/
Host_info: Emily has been teaching Scratch since 2009 in afterschool programs, camps, museums, and libraries. She's excited to show Scratch to new learners and educators.

About: Celebrate Scratch Day with Nucleus Learning Network. Join this free beginner workshop geared towards educators. Bring your own laptop and get introduced to Scratch, a free computer programming language for children. No experience necessary! This class is for beginners with little to no experience with Scratch or computer programming. We will be creating a simple animation, discussing how to teach Scratch to students, and introduce you to the world of Scratch.
FAQs
Who is this workshop for?

We are inviting educators to this workshop - we define educator broadly and hope to get classroom teachers, afterschool program directors, informal educators, homeschool parents, and more at this workshop. No experience necessary, this workshop is designed for beginners. We will be introducing you to Scratch and some approaches to teaching computer programming with students as young as 2nd grade.
What do I need to bring?
Participants need to bring one laptop per educator.  Laptops must be wi-fi enabled, or have the Scratch Desktop Version installed in advance of the workshop: https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch2download/
Host_info: Emily has been teaching Scratch since 2009 in afterschool programs, camps, museums, and libraries. She's excited to show Scratch to new learners and educators.

About: The Global Codeathon began in 2013 when a group of grade 5 students worked with one of our teachers hoping to learn how to code and then bring coding into the classroom. With little direction, the students realized something many adults don’t – that coding has limitless potential. It is much more than syntax to be memorized. It takes away the box and lets students create in new ways.

From this the UNIS Hanoi Elementary Coding Club was formed. One of their first events was organizing the Elementary School’s Hour of Code. The teachers saw how empowering it is to share one’s passion. Some of our least academically motivated students excelled as they were not only teaching other students but administrators too. We want this opportunity to last more than an hour and also want to celebrate our coders’ achievements just as a sports team gets to.
We discussed having students physically meet up at an international coding conference but that would then exclude elementary students. Instead we felt a virtual conference was the best path forward.
Plans: Compete to be the 2015 Global Codeathon Champion (optional)
Connect with awesome coders from around the world in real time
Host_info: Global Codeathon is a virtual conference for Elementary Aged Students and teachers around the world to link up, collaborate and learn together in a connected, engaging way.  The 2015 Global Codeathon is hosted by UNIS Hanoi.

A talking Robot powered by Scratch on Rasberry Pi, who reacts to the physical world through various sensors. A Scratch game with Microsoft Kinect sensor.
This event will be held in Westlake Hills, Austin TX.  We are excited to bring as many of our community together to explore Scratch!
Host_info: Janet Couvillion is an innovative educator determined to ignite children's passion to innovate, create and build.

About: Scratch Day 2015 in Tokyo実行委員会は「Scratch Day 2015 in Tokyo」を2015年5月9日(土)に東京大学 情報学環・福武ホールで開催します。ScratchはMITが開発した教育用プログラミング環境で、会場ではワークショップやデモ展示などを行います。
Scratch Day 2015 in Tokyo実行委員会は「Scratch Day 2015 in Tokyo」を2015年5月9日(土)に東京大学 情報学環・福武ホールで開催します。
Scratchは、MITメディアラボが開発した子供用のプログラミング環境です。すでに世界中で630万人の利用者が900万の作品を作っています。

Scratchは、プログラミング技術の習得自体を目的とせず、ものづくりの手段のひとつとして、その過程で自ら学ぶことを目指しています。そのため、子供たちの大好きなゲームやアニメ、音楽にフォーカスしており、作品をネットで共有するソーシャルメディアの機能も備えています。これにより、時間や場所に限定されない遊びと学びの融合を実現しています。プログラミング教育に対する関心の高まりに合わせて、日本でも学校や企業、NPOなどでの取り組みが進んでおり、新聞やテレビで取り上げられることも増えてきました。

Scratch Dayは年に1度のお祭りで、世界各地で同時にイベントが開催されます。 東京では2009年から開かれており、2013年は600人、2014年は1000人以上の来場者で賑わいました。会場では、ワークショップ、Show & Tell(成果発表会)、識者による鼎談・座談会、プログラミングバトルなど盛りだくさんの内容をご用意しています。皆さんが実際に見て、触れて、参加できるイベントもたくさんあります。
ぜひ Scratch Day 2015 in Tokyoにご参加ください。皆様とお会いできることを楽しみにしております。
会場: 東京大学 情報学環・福武ホール 〒113-0033 東京都文京区本郷7-3-1
Webサイト: http://day.scratch-ja.org/SD2015Tokyo/
主催: Scratch Day 2015 in Tokyo 実行委員会
共催: NPO法人CANVAS
Plans: 鼎談・座談会 (話題のプログラミング教育について、識者による議論を行います)
プログラミングバトル (2人のプログラマーが限られた時間内で課題に挑戦します)
Show & Tell (普段の活動の成果や、当日作ったものを発表します)
参加者全員ワークショップ (ホールの参加者全員でワークショップを行います。申込み不要)
ワークショップ (初心者から上級者まで、さまざまなワークショップをご用意しました(要申込み))
Touch&Try (体験コーナー) (Scratchのいろいろな可能性を実際に触れて遊びながら体験できます)
企業展示 (教材や関連書籍の展示販売です)

About: Everyone is welcome to my free event to learn to Scratch and meet other Scratchers.
The event is in a village hall with power but no internet! So please bring your own laptop and before coming download Scratch Offline editor here https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch2download/
We are planning sessions for beginners and also for more experienced users.
There will be a competition with prizes for the best programs presented at the event!
Light refreshments are available
PLEASE NOTE CHILDREN MUST BE ACCOMPANIED BY AN ADULT THROUGHOUT THE EVENT
Plans: Scratch starter class for absolute beginners
Various tasks and activities for experienced Scratchers
Host_info: I am 14 years old and have been programming on Scratch 1.4 since I got a Raspberry Pi six years ago. I now use Scratch 2.0 online. I also have some Makey Makeys and two Picoboards and I am interested in building a scratch robot.

About: El 9 de mayo es un día para acudir a la Escuela de Ingeniería Informática de la ULPGC y en el que todos podremos disfrutar de una actividad en la universidad.

Como en el resto de actividades planificadas dentro de CodeCraft ULPGC aprenderemos conceptos básicos de programación y durante todo el día podremos trabajar en equipo, solucionar dudas que hayan quedado de sesiones anteriores, etc.
Esta es la última actividad planificada dentro del proyecto CodeCraft para este curso.

Event: Dia do Scratch (Scratch Day) Francisco Beltrão
About: O Dia do Scratch (ou Scratch Day)  é uma rede global de  de eventos que celebra o Scratch - um novo conceito para crianças, jovens e adultos criarem seu código e/ou jogo. Durante o Dia do Scratch, crianças e adultos se reúnem para partilhar projetos e aprender um do outro.
Dia do Scratch também ocorrerá em Francisco Beltrão/PR na Universidade Tecnológica Federal do Paraná. É um evento gratuito para toda a comunidade com Certificado.
Plans: Palestras e oficinas que vão do Scratch Básico, Scratch para jogos e Scratch para Arduino, voltados principalmente para crianças, mas jovens e adultos podem participar.

About: We will have a Scratch game-off where students are given a time limit to create their own original game in Scratch. 3D Printed awards will be given out to the most creative, skillful and original games!

Our programs are goal oriented and focus on hands on learning!

About: Students from Stirling Public School are invited to learn the basics of programming. The session will provide a quick overview of Scratch and will then allow students to explore and be creative. This session will help get students started. From there, the sky is the limit.

About: O Scratch Day  é um evento à escala global onde crianças, jovens e adultos em todo o mundo se reúnem, partilham os seus projectos e aprendem uns com os outros.
Vem celebrar o Scratch Day Lisboa no Pavilhão do Conhecimento e aprender a programar no Scratch com o CoderDojo LX e CoderDojo@Técnico!

Dos 5 aos 17, há sessões para todas as idades: uma sessão de ScratchJr para os ninjas mais novos, dos 5 aos 7 anos, uma sessão de Scratch para os ninjas dos 8 aos 11 e uma outra sessão para os ninjas dos 12 aos 17.

Nestas sessões aprenderás o básico da programação em Scratch, criando os teus projectos e partilhando-os com outros. Haverá também um pequeno concurso para o melhor projecto criado durante o Scratch Day Lisboa por equipas de ninjas já veteranos no Scratch (o tema dos projectos será proposto no próprio dia).

Ah! E não te esqueças de trazer o teu portátil para as sessões de Scratch e um iPad ou um tablet Android (4.4 Kit Kat ou mais recente, mínimo de 7 polegadas) para as sessões de ScratchJr, com o ScratchJr instalado.
Inscrição on-line ou no próprio dia na bilheteira
Para nos contactar ligue-se a: http://www.pavconhecimento.pt/contactar/index.asp?id_endereco=27
Plans: Sessão de ScratchJr para ninjas dos 5 aos 7 anos
Sessão de Scratch para ninjas dos 8 aos 11 anos
Sessão de Scratch para ninjas dos 12 aos 17 anos
Concurso para ninjas veteranos no Scratch
Host_info: Uma colaboração  entre o Pavilhão do Conhecimento e o CoderDojo LX.
Organization: Pavilhão do Conhecimento e CoderDojo LX

About: Am Samstag, den 9. Mai ist der internationale Scratch-Day 2015. In Klagenfurt am Wörthersee findet ein deutschsprachiger Scratch-Day an der Alpen-Adria-Universität Klagenfurt statt.
Für alle Altersklassen von 6-99 Jahre

Der Scratch Day 2015 in Klagenfurt bietet ein Forum für Scratcher und solche die es werden wollen. Neben einem einführenden Kurs in Scratch (besonders für Kinder und ProgrammierEinsteigerInnen geeignet) werden auch Mitmachstationen zu verschiedensten Themen wie Robotik, Informatik, Handyprogrammierung und Computerhardware angeboten. Dazu gibt es auch einen Begegnungsraum wo sich Scratcher austauschen und vernetzen können. Der Eintritt ist frei, eine Anmeldung aber erforderlich.
Das Event wird von der Alpen-Adria-Universität Klagenfurt und dem IEEE Student Branch Klagenfurt organsiert.
The main language of the event is german. However, you will likely find people who can talk also english.

Event: Scratch Day France @TechKidsAcademy - St Germain en Laye
About: TECH KIDS ACADEMY organise, en partenariat avec la ville de St Germain en Laye, une journée spéciale pour apprendre aux enfants à programmer avec Scratch le 9 mai #scratchday.
ATELIERS GRATUITS
Toute la journée du 9 mai, des ateliers ludo-pédagogiques gratuits pour s'initier à la programmation avec Scratch, à partir de 7 ans.
Des ateliers programmation avec MakeyMakey et robots Lego WeDo pour encore plus de fun !
En fin de journée, les parents sont invités à partager avec leurs enfants cette expérience : fabrication et programmation de robots Lego.
Les ateliers ont lieu à la médiathèque de St Germain, Jardin des Arts, Place André Malraux.
Inscription sur le site de la ville : http://www.saintgermainenlaye.fr/la-mairie/ville-numerique/fete-de-linternet-2015/formulaire-ateliers-tech-kids/
Plans: 11h-12h Atelier d'initiation à la programmation avec Scratch
14h-15h Atelier d'initiation à la programmation avec Scratch & MakeyMakey
15h30-16h30 Atelier d'initiation à la programmation avec Scratch & Lego WeDo
Host_info: TECH KIDS ACADEMY, première académie numérique pour les enfants & adolescents, a pour vocation d’apprendre aux enfants l’informatique et les nouvelles technologies, afin de leur permettre de développer leur créativité et révéler leurs talents autour du digital. #éducation #numérique

About: Robofun can’t wait to celebrate National Scratch Day on Saturday May 9th, 2015! Join us for a FREE 3 hour workshop in which students will code their own animations using MIT Media Lab’s Scratch technology. If your child is curious about coding or eager to try something new, Scratch Day is the perfect opportunity to explore! All experience levels welcome. Register online today!
Host_info: RoboFun offers dynamic workshops for children using cutting edge technologies. Children ages 3 – 12 come to our studio on 102nd Street and Broadway in Manhattan to build and program robots, design and construct video games and make stop motion animations.

About: Celebrate Scratch Day 2015 at Markham Public Library.  Join us to learn, create and share Scratch games and animations.
Plans: Let's get to know each other (game)

About: Join us at the Massachusetts Green High Performance Computing Center for a three-hour Scratch Meetup for Educators on Scratch Day!
We welcome educators (teachers, youth educators, informal educators), beginners who would like to learn Scratch, and advanced Scratch users who would like to share projects.

Lunch and refreshments will be served. BYOL (Bring Your Own Laptop), if possible. A limited number of laptops will be available to borrow.  Free wireless is available. If you do not already have an account on the Scratch website, please join Scratch before Scratch Day. Go to http://scratch.mit.edu/ to do so. Parking at the Massachusetts Green High Performance Computing Center is convenient and free.
Meet up with us and connect with other educators who are using Scratch successfully in classrooms in western Massachusetts!
Brought to you by the CSTA of Western Massachusetts and CAITE/ECEP, sponsored by the National Science Foundation
Plans: Hands-on breakout sessions: Getting Started with Scratch; Scrath with LEGO WeDO; Scratch with Middle Schoolers; Scratch with High Schoolers;
Discussion break-out sessions: Scratch & ScratchEd online communities; Using Scratch in informal education or with curricular areas or age groups; Teaching computing concepts with Scratch
Host_info: CAITE (Commonwealth Alliance for Information Technology Education) works to design and carry out comprehensive programs that address under representation in information technology (IT) education and the workforce. For more information on CAITE see: www.caite.info

About: Scratch is an design and coding environment that makes it easy for people to create their own interactive stories, games, animations, and simulations – and share their work with other creators in an online community. Scratch Day is a worldwide network of gatherings designed to bring the people in this community together to meet, share, and learn with Scratch.

Students (Grades 3-8), teachers, and parents who are new to Scratch or have been using Scratch a while are welcome to participate in this event. Students must be accompanied by a sponsoring teacher or adult. Sponsoring adults may bring up to 3 students.

If possible, please bring your own Mac or PC laptop. We will have some laptops available for use.  There is also a version of Scratch (called Scratch Jr.) that works on iOS and Android tablets.  All versions of Scratch are free to download and use.
Participants must pre-register. Attendance is limited to 20 participants.
Plans: Learn about the Scratch online interface and how to create a project
Explore a variety of Scratch projects
Create interactive Scratch projects with Makey-Makey, Arduino, and Microsoft Kinect
Meet other Scratchers in the community
Host_info: The SELF Design Studio is our teacher education makerspace located in the School of Education at the University of North Carolina at Greensboro.

Young Makers Lab will be holding three Scratch Clinics to introduce young makers to our favorite programming language for kids! These free one-hour classes will help kids set up their Scratch accounts, and teach them the basics of programming with Scratch.
The clinics will be held at 9AM, 11AM and 1PM and are limited to the first 12 kids to sign up at :
http://youngmakerslab.com/scratch-day-2015-at-yml-is-may-9th/
In addition to the clinics, our Young Makers will be using Scratch as part of their projects in their Maker Club sessions, as well as in our Raspberry Pi and Video Game Programming Classes.
You can learn more about Young Makers Lab at youngmakerslab.com
Host_info: Kris is a co-owner of Young Makers Lab, a makerspace for kids. YML offers workshops in a variety of 21st century creative tools and skills. Programming, electronics, video game creation, video, and stop motion animation are all made available and accessible to kids by our experienced staff.

About: Just about every Saturday is Scratch Day for Seattle CoderDojo and newcomers are always welcome. Even so, we're planning some extra fun to celebrate Scratch Day.
Registration for the Scratch Day Dojo will open on  April 27th. Sign up for our newsletter at our site to make sure you get a reminder when tickets go live.
Host_info: Seattle CoderDojo is a *free* weekly (well, mostly weekly) coding club for kids held in the South Lake Union area of downtown Seattle. If you have a lot of fun on Scratch Day, you'll be able to come back and have more fun with Scratch in our weekly Scratch Room.

Host_info: Community of Dubuque Makers organized to promote a maker culture in the areas of art, software, electronics design, 3D printing and fabrication.

About: Join us at the Kennedy-Longfellow School Makerspace in Cambridge, MA for this free three-hour BYOL (Bring Your Own Laptop) meetup for Scratch educators and their families! This Scratch Day Meetup will be a chance to meet other area educators who are also interested in Scratch. The meetup is held in a participatory professional development/EdCamp style session. Free breakfast and lunch will be provided.
Free parking is available in the school parking lot behind the school off of Fulkerson Street. The meetup is a short 10 minute walk from the MBTA Red Line Kendall Stop if taking the T.

The Kennedy-Longfellow Makerspace is a open space with plenty of resources to explore the many possibilities with Scratch. For example, the space has Lego We-Do Kits, MakeyMakey, littleBits, WiFi access, and access to laptops to borrow if needed.
Come play and learn at this special Scratch Day meetup!
Plans: Build our schedule together! (like EdCamp, participatory)

Breakout Sessions covering topics such as lesson planning/lesson ideas, working with different age groups and Scratch, teaching computer science, exploration of different devices that connect with Scratch, etc.

About: Bring your own device and join us for some programming with Scratch.

Newbies will walk through Scratch cards at their own pace while experienced Scratch programmers collaborate to create a Scratch program for teaching students about conductivity and resistance using a MakeyMakey-like device (see www.makeymakey.com for the basic idea).
Can't wait to know whether a carrot or raisin has more resistance?  Then rsvp now!  Seating is limited to 10 since this event is being held at a private residence.
Plans: Collaboration to design and begin creation of a conductivity and resistance educational Scratch program using a custom-made MakeyMakey

About: יום הסקראץ' יתקיים השנה ביום שישי, 8.5.14, בין השעות 8:30-12:30 במרכז הבינתחומי בהרצליה.
המעבדה לחדשנות במדיה של בית ספר סמי עופר לתקשורת מפעילה כבר כמה שנים את תוכנית סקראץ' ישראל בה מתנדבים סטודנטים מכל הקמפוס כדי לעודד שימוש בתוכנה במסגרות חינוכיות ברחבי הארץ.
ביום סקראץ הבינלאומי אנחנו מזמינים ילדים שמכירים וכאלה שעדיין לא, לבוא וליצור בסקראץ'.
מה בתוכנית?
8:30-8:45- התכנסות וכיבוד קל ברחבת הדשא מול הספרייה
9:00-11:30- סדנאות יצירה בחלוקה לרמות
11:30-12:30- שיתוף פרויקטים וסיכום האירוע
הסדנאות מיועדות לילדים החל מגיל 8 ויש להרשם מראש, מספר המקומות מוגבל!
L’objectiu principal de la matinal serà compartir pares i fills una bona estona mentre aprenem a fer funcionar el programa i compartir els projectes realitzats.
Veurem que crear videojocs i animacions no és gaire complicat.
Les activitats van dirigides doncs a educadors, famílies, nens i nenes amb ganes d’aprendre a utilitzar el programa.
Descripció:
* El taller s’adreça principalment a nens i nenes de cicle mitjà i superior. Volem que sigui una jornada familiar on pares i fills puguin compartir una bona estona.
* El maquinari de l’escola és limitat per tant, no podrem assegurar que hi hagi una màquina per cada nen o nena i recomanem que tothom que
pugui es porti el seu ordinador portàtil.
L’agenda orientativa del taller és la següent:
•	9:30 - 10:00h: Arribada benvinguda i preparació de l’entorn.
•	10:00 - 10:30h: Breu introducció a l'Scratch
•	10:30 - 11:30h: Scratch Cards
•	11:30 - 12:00h: Descans (hi haurà begudes i un petit esmorzar)
•	12:00 - 13:00h: Realització d’un joc complet. L’objectiu és realitzar jocs per parvulari i cicle inicial.
•	13:00 - 13:30: Compartir els jocs a la galeria comuna. Parlarem de com provar el programari dels altres, aportar millores i cor

About: Join us for this annual event that celebrates Scratch, the visual programming language developed by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) to teach young people the fundamentals of computer coding.

Fun 2 Learn Code will provide hands-on projects for children and adults to explore Scratch and learn how the program can be used to create stories, animations and games. To register for this free event, please visit http://fun2learncode.com/events/.  Registration is only needed if you plan to attend one of the two classes (registration is not needed to participate in the on-going demonstrations).
Plans: During this event, participants will have the opportunity to learn to create the classic video Pong game with Scratch
Learn how Scratch can be used for art and creativity
Learn how to share and remix Scratch projects
Explore Makey Makey to turn everyday objects into keys and use them with Scratch
Host_info: Fun 2 Learn Code offers classes and summers camps in the Austin/Central Texas area for young people to learn the fundamentals of computer programming.

Event: Celebrating Scratch Day at Carme Auguet School, Girona.
About: This was a Scratch Day event on May 9th 2016
9:30 - 11:30. Students from 4th, 5th and 6th grade were invited by Narcis Xifre School to share their projects and experiences about robotics and its programming.

11:30 - 13h. Students from Kindergarten up to 3rd graders did many robotic activities  in the same school. Some of them were: makey, makey; maths games; playing chess online and in-person; creating a diary by Scrapbook; playing puzzles, and so on.

15:00 - 16:45 Students from 4th up to 6th graders were the monitors to carry out diferent activities to the rest of students. They divided into diferent groups: Kindergarten and Primary. In each group, there were five different activities to play with. Some of them were: playing by Kinet, Code, beebots, QR , AR, etc with diferent devices.
That day, the whole school were wearing the orange Scratch T-shirt. Teachers and students spent a great great time programming, sharing, playing together with robotics and learning one from another.
16:45. Final assembly to celebrate the Scratch Day all together.
Spend the afternoon coding in Scratch to celebrate Scratch Day http://day.scratch.mit.edu!
The coding session is mainly aimed at KS2 (Years 3-6) children. But siblings and keen young programmers are welcome too. Children have to be accompanied by an Adult/Carer.
The session starts at 2PM but you don't have to stay the length of it. The PTA will run a Refreshment Stall to feed caffeine to the Adults :-)
You can bring your own laptop if you want to. Just download Scratch on your computer before you come: https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch2download/.
Host_info: Dad of a 12yo daughter at Parkside, and 10yo son at St Matthew's.

About: The Scratch Day will be hold in Escola Carme Auguet on May 15th,2015 from 9:30a.m until 4:30p.m.
We invite three other schools to share, create and have fun all together. We are going to be around 220 persons at the same place for the same reason: celebrate the Scratch Day.

One of the hits of this event is the video conference with Claudia Urrea. She has over 20 years of experience in the field of Education and Technology. She will explain and answer some questions about using Scratch in the school.

We thanks  Agustí Gifre School, Sta. Margarida School and Dalmau Carles School to participate at this great event. We also wants to say thank you to the researchers, teachers from the University of Girona (Udg), Centre Recursos Pedagògics del Gironès to help us to manage the Scratch Day in our school.
Plans: Each Primary Cycle students from our school will welcome other students from the same level and will show the school.
From 10a.m to 11a.m all the schools will share diferents Scratch projects.
After breakfast, we will do a GymKana to play, create, program diferent  activities.

After lunch, the researches and teachers from University of Girona (Udg) will do workshops for students while the teachers will be at the video conference with Claudia Urrea in order to learn more about using Scratch at school.

At the end, we will take a picture with all the participants wearing the same T-shirt and around a big cat made by ballons.  Later on, it will be a present for each school to remember Scracth Day celebreted in Escola Carme Auguet.

statt.
Die Veranstaltung ist für Kinder von 9 bis 15 Jahren
Eltern, Lehrerinnen und Lehrer,
Jugendleiterinnen und Jugendleiter
geeignet.

Auf dem Programm steht für Neueinsteiger der Anfang mit Scratch. Fortgeschrittene (z.B. Teilnehmende aus den Vorjahren) können sich untereinander austauschen und Fragen an die Tutoren stellen bzw. neue Tipps mitnehmen.

Um Anmeldung per E-Mail an kiju@hasi.it oder direkten Kontakt über den Veranstalter wird gebeten. Wenn möglich, einen eigenen Rechner mitbringen (es ist nur eine begrenzte Zahl von Leihrechnern verfügbar).
Die Teilnahme ist kostenlos. Für Getränke und Snacks vor Ort wird ein bisschen Taschengeld benötigt.
* Der Termin ist dieses Jahr nicht genau am Scratch Day, um unseren Tutoren die Teilnahme am Scratch-DACH-Day am 9.5. zu ermöglichen.

About: Bienvenido al primer Scratch Day de Venezuela. Una experiencia fascinante de aprendizaje y amistad que se llevará a cabo el próximo 9 de mayo de 2015 alrededor del mundo, cuando miles de entusiastas de la programación visual y el pensamiento computacional se encontrarán para compartir sus experiecias en la codificación y creación de proyectos en el lenguaje Scratch. Esta es la primera ocasión en la que Venezuela participará en el "Día Mundial de Scratch" a través del entusiasmo y la excelencia académica de la ilustre Universidad Nacional Experimental de Los Llanos Occidentales Ezequiel Zamora (Unellez) que, desde el Subproyecto de Informática en Educación concentrará a sus estudiantes, profesores e invitados en una jornada para "imaginar, programar y compartir"el "aprender a programar, programar para aprender". Bienvenido a este primer "Scratch Day" de la Unellez y de Venezuela. Lugar: Laboratorio A de Informática, Barinas 1, VPDS, Barinas.
Plans: 1. Bienvenida y declaración de la agenda.
2. Desconferencia: El Pensamiento Computacional en Scratch (Prof. Germán Calatrava).
3. Feria de Programación: Muestra de Proyectos (Estudiantes de Informática en Educación).
4. Presentación cultural (Expresión Llanera: Cuatro y alpargatas)
5. Workshop: Codificación Básica en la Programación Visual (Prof.a Francys González).
6. Reto Scratch: Algoritmos y Codificación Visual en Scratch.
Host_info: Prof. de Edumática en la Universidad Ezequiel Zamora (Unellez) adscrito al  Vicerrectorado de Planificación y Desarrollo Social de Barinas, Venezuela. Coordinador del Scratch Day 2018 en Venezuela como "Bitmix {CodeHouse} - Feel Good".

Οι μαθητές των μικρότερων τάξεων θα παίξουν τα παιχνίδια που δημιούργησαν οι μαθητές των μεγαλύτερων τάξεων.
Druga edycja konkursu na szkolnego Mistrza Kodowania.  Organizowany jest przez nauczycieli prowadzących zajęcia z Projektu Mistrzowie
Kodowania oraz Przedstawiciela Rodziców.
Konkurs polega na rozwiązywaniu przez grupę uczniów zadań w środowisku Scratch.
Poszerza treści podstawy programowej przedmiotu Zajęcia Komputerowe w szkole
podstawowej i sprawdza umiejętności uczniów zdobyte na zajęciach z programowania.
Konkurs jest jedną z form odchodów Międzynarodowego Dnia Scratcha w naszej szkole.
Plans: 1. Treści zadań konkursowych uczestnicy otrzymują w trakcie zawodów.
2. Na rozwiązanie zadań grupy mają 80 minut.
3. Każdy zespół rozwiązuje zadania przy wyznaczonym stanowisku pracy, przygotowanym przez organizatora konkursu.
4. Zawodnicy są zobowiązani do zachowania w tajemnicy swoich rozwiązań w czasie trwania zawodów.
5. Ukończoną w części lub całości pracę zespół zgrywa na nośnik, który przekazuje Komisji Konkursu.
6. Po dokonaniu oceny rozwiązań Komisja Konkursu ustali i opublikuje liczbę punktów uzyskanych przez każdą z grup.

Event: Scratch Day Boulder/ Mother's Day Celebration
About: KidzCode.Org and Galvanize Boulder present Scratch Day!

Join us in a family coding event and be part of the global Scratch Day celebration in Boulder! This day also falls near Mother's Day so let's make Mom a special card.  KidzCode will show you how to program an interactive project using Scratch and ScratchJr. Express your love to Mom by coding a personalize message to her.   Please bring your own device and this is NOT a drop-off event.
Plans: 10-11 AM:  ScratchJr. This is geared for 5-7 years old.  Please bring your own iPad or Android Tablet with the ScratchJr. App pre-installed on your own device.

11-12 Noon: Scratch 2.0. Newcomers and advance Scratchers will learn how to make an interactive Mother’s Day card. Please bring your own laptop. We will be using the Scratch 2.0, web-based software so you won't need to download any software. You will need to have an email address to register for a Scratch account. Scratch is geared for 8-16 years old or if they are ready to progress from ScratchJr.
12-1 PM:  Present and share your projects with fellow Scratchers and learn from your peers.
Limited to 30 students so pre-registration is required.
Host_info: A company dedicated to teaching kids how to think computationally and to help prepare them for challenges and demands of the 21st century. For more information regarding their teaching philosophy please visit www.kidzcode.org

About: Introduction for beginners and 90 minute hackathon for experienced Scratchers at Expo Park, Osaka.  Please bring your own PC!
Host_info: We need to cultivate the creativity of kids as they grow older, particularly as they get drawn in by digital media.  Teaching Scratch and robotics is a fun hobby for me!

About: Derde Haarlemse Scratchdag
Zaterdag 9 mei van 13:30 - 16:30

Samen programmeren voor en door jong en oud in Scratch als eerste kennismaking en voor gevorderden. Samen muziekmachientjes, nieuwe games, en interactieve verhalen bouwen. We maken opstellingen met ScratchJr, Scratch, Lego WeDo, MaKey en Picoboards.
Dit jaar kun je ook kennis maken met 2 robotjes: de Ozobot en Dash
Vorige jaren hebben we een kettingreactie gebouwd tussen twee computers.
Die kettingreactie willen we dit jaar verder uitbouwen.
En natuurlijk hebben we een nieuwe game, die je kunt maken en aanpassen.
Je mag je eigen laptop/iPad meenemen.
Schrijf je hier gratis in om verzekerd te zijn van een computerplek: http://bit.ly/inschrijvenScratchdag

Bekijk hier de fotofilm van 2013 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D_IdL98Tfy8&list=PLiOjtUkxrNwVlj-Uw2xGO-IlZSPxcLrrB  en een geslaagde Goldbergmachine https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7UtjjPZ97LU&list=PLiOjtUkxrNwVlj-Uw2xGO-IlZSPxcLrrB
Plaats: Badhuis Leidseplein 49, 2013 PW Haarlem
Host_info: Leren door animeren en programmeren: hetdigilab verzorgt workshops, clinics, lessen, cursussen en projectondersteuning voor leerlingen, studenten en volwassenen op locatie.

About: Lo Scratch Day sarà un'opportunità per programmare e creare, aperta a studenti di tutte le età: esperti, principianti, genitori e insegnanti. In ognuna delle scuole partecipanti si svolgeranno alcuni laboratori pratici. Tramite la online meeting room di Scientix (http://www.scientix.eu/) alcune classi italiane ed europee lavoreranno su un progetto comune, il cui tema sarà svelato all'inizio della giornata. Tramite la contemporaneità dei vari workshop e la condivisione finale dei lavori prodotti i ragazzi proveranno la sensazione di lavorare all'interno di una comunità scientifica.
I ragazzi più grandi realizzeranno i progetti con Scratch; i più piccoli potranno utilizzare Scratchjr.

Scratch Day is a chance to plan and create, open to students of all ages: experts, beginners, parents and teachers. Through the  online meeting room of Scientix (http://www.scientix.eu/) some  Italian and European classes will work on a common theme,  which will be revealed at the beginning of the event. In each of the participating school will take place a workshop.  Younger students (5 to 8 yr.) are encouraged to use Scratchjr and share their projects!
Plans: event will have also an "online meeting room", through  Scientix
Host_info: Scratch è utilizzato nel nostro Istituto all'interno dei curricoli di matematica e scienze in alcune classi della scuola secondaria, primaria e anche nella scuola dell'infanzia per promuovere l'interesse verso le materie STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Maths) e sviluppare competenze.

Event: Scratch Day with Creative Coding 4 Kids!
About: Get together with Creative Coding 4 Kids and celebrate Scratch!

Kids and adults of all levels can come work on projects together and learn more about the Scratch learning environment. Bring your own laptop or borrow one of ours, but supplies are limited. Get creative, share ideas, and most importantly: Have fun!

Grade 7 students have been creating educational games for elementary students.  They will share their Scratch games with the elementary students and teachers on this day for testing, feedback and celebration of creative coding!
Host_info: I am a Design teacher and Middle School Tech Coordinator.

About: Organizadores: Departamento de Computación.
Tutores: Alumnos de 6to año y Docentes.

Los alumnos de 6to año 1era división de la especialidad Computación, expondrán las habilidades adquiridas en el manejo del software Scratch, trabajados durante el proyecto solidario: Historietas Puneñas.

Dirigido tanto a orientar a conocer la programación desde una perspectiva innovadora, con bloques de código, como trabajar en un nivel intermedio con alumnos del establecimiento, de 7mo grado nivel primario, docentes, y aficionados a la nuevas tecnologías.
Plans: Conocer el lenguaje, su interface y comandos.
Interactuar con los programas creados por los alumnos.
Host_info: El evento se organizará en el establecimiento de la Escuela Técnica, junto a los alumnos de 6to 1era de la especialidad Computación. Los mismos están trabajando en un Proyecto solidario con los alumnos del Colegio Secundario Nº50 Localidad: Santuario de Tres Pozos – De, en crear historietas Puneñas.

About: La celebración del Scratch Day UOC tendrá lugar de 9: 30h a 13: 30h, simultáneamente en diferentes sedes de la UOC: Barcelona, Salt, Lleida, Madrid y Sevilla y este año se enmarca en las acciones del Grupo Inventa de los Estudios de Informática, Multimedia y Telecomunicación, con motivo de la celebración de los 20 años de la UOC.

El Scratch Day UOC en Sevilla propone en un taller donde se aprenderá a utilizar el entorno Scratch y donde se programará un videojuego. Este taller está dirigido a niñas y niños de 8 a 13 años (acompañados por un adulto) y no requiere ningún conocimiento previo.
La actividad tendrá lugar en la sede de la UOC en Sevilla (Avda. Torneo, 32), es gratuita y requiere registro previo.
Mas información:
http://inventa.uoc.edu/proyectos/scratch-day/scratch-day-2015/

La celebración del Scratch Day UOC tendrá lugar de 9: 30h a 13: 30h, simultáneamente en diferentes sedes de la UOC: Barcelona, Salt, Lleida, Madrid y Sevilla y este año se enmarca en las acciones del Grupo Inventa de los Estudios de Informática, Multimedia y Telecomunicación, con motivo de la celebración de los 20 años de la UOC.

El Scratch Day UOC en Madrid propone en un taller donde se aprenderá a utilizar el entorno Scratch y donde se programará un videojuego. Este taller está dirigido a niñas y niños de 8 a 13 años (acompañados por un adulto) y no requiere ningún conocimiento previo.
La actividad se realizará en la sede de la UOC de Madrid (Plaza de las Cortes, 2), es gratuita y requiere registro previo.
Mas información:
http://inventa.uoc.edu/proyectos/scratch-day/scratch-day-2015/

La celebració del Scratch Day a la UOC tindrà lloc de de 9:30h a 13:30h, simultàniament a diferents seus de la UOC: Barcelona, Salt, Lleida, Madrid i Sevilla i aquest any s'emmarca en les accions del Grup Inventa dels Estudis d’Informàtica, Multimèdia i Telecomunicació, amb motiu de la celebració dels els 20 anys de la UOC.

El Scratch Day UOC a Barcelona consisteix en un taller,  on s'aprendrà a utilitzar l'entorn Scratch i on es construirà un videojoc. Aquest taller s'adreça a nenes i nens de 8 a 13 anys (acompanyats per un adult) i no requereix cap coneixement previ.
A més, a la seu de Barcelona es realitzen dos activitats més:
-Taller de Scratch avançat
-Racons: Espais d'interacció amb Scratch i Lego, Makey Makey, Arduino, Kinect i Scratch Cards.

Totes les activitats són gratuïtes i es realitzen al MWC (Pl.Catalunya amb Portal de l'Angel). Els tallers requereixen registre previ. Els "racons"  no requereixen registre i es pot accedir a qualsevol hora.
Per a més informació:
http://inventa.uoc.edu/projectes/scratch-day/scratch-day-2015/

Event: Scratch Day in the context of the 8th Pan-Hellenic Educational Conference “Information and Communication Technologies” (June, 26-28 2015)
About: Scratch Day in the context of the 8th Pan-Hellenic Educational Conference “Information and Communication Technologies” (June, 26-28 2015) organized by the Unions e-diktyo (www.e-diktyo.eu) and "Michalis Dertouzos" (www.ekped.gr) and University of Aegean in Syros, Greece.

Primary and Secondary Education teachers along with researchers would participate in interactive tutorials where they share and discuss experiences on design and implementing learning activities using Scratch 2.0.
Plans: hands-on workshops to introduce newcomers to Scratch 2.0 •
sessions where educators share Scratch experiences.

About: Im Mai findet weltweit der diesjährige Scratch Day statt. Auch das InfoSphere ist am 16. Mai mit einem eigenen Scratch Day dabei.
Scratch Day ist ein weltweites Netzwerk, bei dem es darum geht Kinder und Jugendliche mittels der sehr einfachen Programmierumgebung Scratch zu kleinen Programmierer-inne-n zu machen.
Bei diesem Event sind groß und klein gemeinsam eingeladen. Alle Kids ab Klasse 5 dürfen gemeinsam mit einem Elternteil oder älteren Geschwisterkind teilnehmen, alle ab Klasse 7 auch ohne Anhang.
Ihr braucht absolut kein Vorwissen mitzubringen (auch die Erwachsenen nicht :-)). Wie ihr im Bild links seht wird hier mit Puzzlebausteinen programmiert. Das lernt ihr sicherlich ganz schnell.
Wenn ihr dabei sein möchtet, könnt ihr euch hier anmelden. Mehr Infos zu dem Inhalt des Moduls findet ihr hier.
Wir freuen uns auf euch und eure tollen Projektideen!
Euer InfoSphere-Team

Junto con la Asociación ALCE, desarrollaremos un taller de introducción a la programación con Scratch en Centro de Asociaciones de El Casar (Guadalajara) el día 9 de mayo.

About: Biblioteca Digital TELMEX te invita al taller  crear tu primer videojuego con Scratch. El evento se levará a cabo el próximo 12 de mayo.  Aquí aprenderás los pasos necesarios para hacer lograrlo, usando programación por bloques. ¡Te esperamos!

About: The May 12 will develop in the Centro Escolar Solalto the Scratch Day. We invite Pre-primary schools friends to share a wonderful day with our students. Develop various activities robotics and programming , and culminate on presenting the projects in Scratch event.
Out Coderdojo meets 11.30am - 1pm every 2nd and 3rd Saturday of month.
We've a number of ninja's who regularly use Scratch to program anything from Robotic cars to animating their own amazing videos.
Join us at the library and you could end up knowing how you can use a banana to play a song or to control a game using a sheet of paper!

Introduction to Scratch for those new the group

About: A special CoderDojo into the wood!

Every 2nd and 4th Saturday of the month girls ages 8-18 come to the Computer Clubhouse of Tacoma to engage in STEM activities. On May 9th, we will use Scratch (with Makey Makey) to tell stories from our community! These stories can include positive changes, education, role models, after school fun, and much more!

Event: ScratchDojo - Una "palestra informatica" per piccoli programmatori
About: The project aims to introduce children to "computational thinking" and coding, in order to stimulate an active and conscious use of digital technologies.

Through a playful approach, with the construction of an object-game made independently by each participant, there is also proposed to experiment with the children the advantage of working in partnership, in the realization of small projects and solving problems.
The project is reserved for students of the fifth class of primary school "De Amicis".

The activity, completely free, is divided into three modules of three hours. Meetings will be held at our school on Saturday mornings from 9:00 to 12:00, with a snack break of 15 minutes, on the following dates: Saturday, March 28, Saturday, April 11, Saturday, May 9.
CoderDojo Kenmore is one of CoderDojo Brisbane's 5 permanent Dojo locations.
See our Spritebots in action!  These unique drawing machines are controlled with hand motion as detected by a Lego-we-do-sensor. All of this is programmed by Scratch.

We will also feature our "Notebot" or a musical instrument using Scratch. This consists of a small Lego-built motor, with strings tied like the arms of a windmill, that plays a stringed instrument by repetitive motion generated using a Scratch program.
We also encourage our visitors to come up with other creative and unique ways to incorporate Scratch programming with physical objects.
CoderDojo Brisbane Square is one of CoderDojo Brisbane's 5 permanent Dojo locations across Brisbane.
Work at your own pace as you solve one of our coding challenges; perhaps you'll choose to create a game, to control a robot or play some music!

Lo Scratch Day sarà un'opportunità per studenti, genitori, insegnanti e per chiunque vorrà intervenire, di capire cos'è Scratch, il fenomeno mondiale che sta cambiando il modo d'imparare attraverso la programmazione.

Con Scratch ogni bambino può imparare come si programma un computer e comprendere così la tecnologia in cui è immerso quotidianamente. Ma Scratch è anche un formidabile strumento didattico per il curricolo tradizionale. Venite a sentire perché in questo evento che si svolge durante il corso di Scratch nelle scuole G. Franceschi e F. De André.

È previsto il collegamento con altre scuole nazionali ed europee attraverso  la online meeting room di Scientix (http://www.scientix.eu/): un'opportunità in più per costruire un'Europa sempre più coesa e vicina, sopra tutto, ai più giovani.
Come and see what is Scratch during this worldwide event, in which you have the opportunity to learn how, through learning computer programming, teaching can change!
We will connect with other schools, both in Italy as well as in Europe, to understand how large is this community and to build the Europe of th
Plans: Alle 11:00: inizio manifestazione e collegamento con le altre scuole per i saluti
A seguire: dimostrazioni sull'uso di Scratch
Per finire: interventi di bambini e insegnanti

About: Nei Dojo bambini tra i 7 e i 13 anni imparano a scrivere codice, a sviluppare siti web, app, programmi e giochi. L'obiettivo del CoderDojo e rendere il processo di apprendimento divertente, sociale e veramente cool!
CoderDojoRE, come tutti i Dojo, ha una sola regola "Soprattutto sii in gamba!": fare il bullo, mentire, far perdere tempo agli altri non è da persone in gamba.
Dove e quando
Biblioteca Comunale di Vezzano sul Crostolo, sabato 9 maggio dalle 15 alle 18
Cosa portare
le bambine ed i bambini dovranno venire con:
-computer portatile (ricordatevi il caricabatterie) possibilmente con preinstallato Scratch vers. 2
-una merenda: a metà pomeriggio faremo una pausa di circa 10 minuti
-un genitore o un altro adulto dovrà accompagnare la bimba o il bimbo e rimanere in una zona a fianco per tutta la durata.
Cosa faremo
Il programma punta sulla curiosità e intelligenza tipica dei bambini e degli adolescenti.
I ragazzi sono incoraggiati a fare quello che più si addice alle loro qualità e desideri senza alcun obiettivo di valutazione sui risultati.

LEAD创意活动中国区组委会及黄浦区青少年科技活动中心将于2015年5月16日举办 “亲近中国文化”——2015年Scratch Day China主题活动。
Wellcome! Join us!
Making a Scratch project！
We would like to invite you who want to meet, learn and sharing with Scratch activities！
Plans: 活动人员：小学、初中、高中及大学在校学生
活动地点：上海市黄浦区青少年科技活动中心（上海市建国西路137号，近陕西南路）底楼大厅
评选项目：scratch软件作品创意设计。 参赛组别分为：A组（使用外接传感器）、B组（不使用外接传感器） 作品类别包括但不限于（供参考）： 1．趣味游戏类：各类趣味小程序、益智游戏等； 2．应用程序类：各应用小程序、小工具、辅助学习工具等； 3．管理系统类：管理系统程序等； 4、故事动画类：小动画、小故事等； 5、扩展类： 其他等。

相关要求 ：1、作品的主题：亲近中国文化 作品需结合主题，可从自身平时的学习、实践生活出发，要求作品原创、健康、积极向上，具有较为明确的设计思想。若作品能为社会应用和科技创新服务则是最好。 2、作品的内容分类包括但不限于（供参考）： 民族歌曲、古诗文诵读、寓言故事等； 中华饮食文化等； 指南针等各种科技发明； 其他等。 3、参赛的模式：小队合作 本次活动以参赛队形式参赛，每校最多不超过3支，每支参赛队人数不超过3人。队员之间需进行合理、有效分工，体现小队合作成果。 参赛队请自备手提电脑、U盘或移动硬盘等各类制作设备。

评比指标及办法：作品应能在计算机、智能终端或手机上运行。设计简单、突出趣味性、实用性。 评价的方式：自评与互评相结合的描述性评价方式（组委会现场提供评分表）。 描述性评价采用自评和互评相结合的方法，每支参赛队先对自己的作品进行评价，随后同一小组中各参赛队之间互评，产生互评得分。每个小组内由互评得分最高的参赛队进行现场成果展示。凡参与成果展示的参赛队除了要介绍scratch作品以外，还需介绍自己的团队/作者组成、作品创作思路、创作过程、原创内容说明等内容。

现场流程： 12:45——13:00	参赛队伍报到、设备调试。活动主办方拟将6-8支参赛队编为一个参赛组。 13:00——13:45	创作调整阶段。参赛队在45分钟内对作品进行创作调整、完善及自评，并可参观同组内其他参赛队作品。 13:45——14:15	参赛组小组互评阶段。 14:15——15:00	全场互相交流、互玩阶段。投票产生全场人气大奖，各学校教师及参赛队可进行Scratch成果推介及展示。 15:00	活动总结及颁奖仪式

报名要求、时间：（1）参赛学生必须以学校为单位统一申报 （2）学校与学校之间不做联队 2、申报方式 本次比赛采用电子表格申报的方式，请各参赛单位于2015年5月10日前，将《2015年Scratch Day China 主题活动报名表》以及《第二届Scratch专业委员会成员申请表》（详情请见附件）两份电子报名表发送到组委会指定邮箱：scratchdaychina@163.com进行申报。本活动通知及报名表可于4月22日后登陆上海市黄浦区青少年科技活动中心网站（http://www.hdzx.lwedu.sh.cn）、LEAD网站（http://www.shedunews.com/omchina_lead）下载。
奖项设置：各参赛队根据作品互评得分获相应各类特色奖项(最佳技术奖、情节奖、造型奖、主题奖、音乐奖、合作奖、界面奖、创意奖、原创奖、改编奖)。 本次活动还设“优秀指导奖”及“全场人气大奖”（分小初高），由全场互玩阶段作品得票数最高的参赛队获得。 活动结束后，主办单位对展示作品拥有宣传、刊登、汇编的使用权。
活动子单元：创客DIY作品展示区 向参赛学生及指导教师征集各类小发明、小创作（主题不限，包括但不限于使用Scratch等各类软硬件结合制作的小创作）要求作品理念健康、积极向上，具有较为明确的设计思想。每单位申报作品不超过两件，并请在回执处附作品简介。作品底面尺寸不超过0.4mx0.4m，高度不超过0.6m，材料不限。 本单元参展名额有限，先到先录。主办方将颁发参展证明。

其他： 1、Scratch Day主题优秀作品及创客DIY优秀作品将有机会巡游全国。 2、本次活动欢迎各兄弟省市、区县相关单位、学校、教师及学生前来观摩、交流。前来观摩者请填写下方观摩回执并邮件至scratchdaychina@163.com，谢谢配合。 3、主办方为向各参赛队提供更好服务，确保活动秩序安全，若同一时段活动现场人员过多将会实行限流，请各位参与者服从现场工作人员安排。 4、本次活动免费，其余费用请自理。 5、活动地点周边交通：公交17路、24路、41路、96路、146路、301路、786路等，地铁9号线（嘉善路站2号口出）。
Organization: LEAD创意活动中国区组委会

About: Oficina que apresenta a jovens, crianças, alunos e professores que gostam de programação e de programar, o ambiente SCRATCH, do Media-Labs do MIT, para programação e desenvolvimento de projetos, como jogos e animações.
LOCAL: Universidade de Caxias do Sul - Bloco 71 - Sala 206
Inscrições pelo e-mail:  lmadanie@ucs.br
Vagas limitadas!
This is an invitation for kids between 8 and 12 years old who are interested in creating their own video games through the Scratch programming language.
Each kid must bring his/her own laptop computer with mouse and mouse pad.
Before the event, please download and install the Scratch Offline Editor from here:
https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch2download/
This is a collection of sample projects that we'll be building:
https://scratch.mit.edu/studios/1206380/projects
Plans: 9:00 - 9:30 Welcome. Software installation. Introductions. Online user names. Offline backups.
9:30 - 10:00 Introduction to Scratch: the tools and the jargon. Role-play: enacting the code. Hands-On play advanced games.
10:00 - 11:00 Building 3 games: racing, chasing, and crazy music band.
11:30 - 12:30 Collaboration! Mixing and learning from others.
Host_info: Alejandro is taking on his own hands what his local Elementary school is failing to do: teach his son (b. '03) and daughter (b. '05) computer programming skills.

About: La Universidad Pedagógica Nacional en el Estado de Veracruz, La Secretaría de Educación Veracruz, El Colegio Las Hayas y el grupo Edukre@tivos
Invitan al Día Mundial de Scratch 2015
A realizarse los días 22 y 23 de mayo de 2015
Propósito.

Acercar a estudiantes, docentes, padres de familia y cualesquier interesado a herramientas tecnológicas, principalmente asociadas a Scratch, que permitan realizar  proyectos educativos en ambientes de aprendizaje colaborativos .
De lo académico
Para Scratch 2015  proponemos el desarrollo de proyectos creativos donde se compartan habilidades, competencias, saberes, que puedan integrarse en uno sólo, como eje rector.
"La aventura de la vida"
Y puedan ser trabajados desde cualquier asignatura, nivel académico, ambientes de aprendizaje con libertad y ser compartidos con todos los participantes de Scratch Day.

Adultos:     $150.00

About: 本イベントは高校生〜大学生（文理不問）を対象としています。
ブロックを組み合わせるだけで簡単にプログラムが開発でき、専門的な知識を必要としない開発環境である「Scratch」を使ったプログラミング体験教室を行います。
Scratchでのプログラミングに加えて、つないだものをキーボード化する【MaKey MaKey】、手や指先などの細かなジェスチャーで入力を行う【Leap Motion】などのIT機器とScratchを組み合わせたオリジナルの楽器やゲームなどの開発を予定しています。

Crear juegos interactivos en los que los niños de pre escolar y primer grado puedan aprender y aplicar el pensamiento lógico mediante el desarrollo de comandos  básicos de Scratch.
Los estudiantes de Tree of Life International School (TOLIS)  crearán juegos y materiales utilizando Makey Makey y Lego WeDo.
Para esto se designan proyectos que se trabajan durante el mes de mayo.
Esto promueve el trabajo en equipo, el liderazgo estudiantil, el refuerzo de los conocimientos adquiridos y la ciudadania digital.
El día Scratch los creadores se convierten en profesores y facilitadores para motivar a los más pequeños en aprender y desarrollar su pensamiento lógico dentro del marco de Creative Computing.
Plans: 1. Pre day: Trabajo en proyectos de Scratch para los grados superiores
Revision de los proyectos para el Scratch Day

Nuestro estilo de enseñanza está basado en promover valores, carácter y crecimiento espiritual, para que crezcan siendo capaces de influenciar y desarrollarse de la mejor forma. Somos una escuela Tri-lingual, English, Mandarin y Spanish.

Misión - Developing Greatness and Leadership Every Day

About: Are you interested to learn more about Scratch? Beginners and seasoned coders are invited to join the Coder Dojo / YRS club as we celebrate World Scratch Day.

Attendees should bring a laptop. Although WiFi is available, you may wish to download Scratch for free before hand: https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch2download/

About: El Centro Educacional de la Asociación de Profesores de la Universidad de Los Andes 'CEAPULA' atiende al llamado entusiasta que a nivel mundial promueve el Instituto Tecnológico de Massachusetts 'MIT' a través del 'Scratch Day' y que permitirá compartir con miles de niños, jóvenes y adultos experiencias de programación visual orientadas por el pensamiento computacional y la visión STEM.

Se realizó una primera jornada el día anterior al 'Scratch Day 2015' en donde se entusiasmó a la comunidad y se programó los encuentros Scratch presenciales y Online durante los próximos meses de mayo y junio de 2015 en donde se impartiran materiales y orientaciones para abordar y desarrollar proyectos creados por los estudiantes de 3.er Grado bajo la orientación de sus padres y docentes.
Estás invitado a participar en el Aula Virtual de CEAPULA del Curso 'Programa tu juego Scratch' en la dirección Web: www.ceapula.web.ve/aulavirtual/moodle
Plans: Bienvenida y declaración de la agenda
De casa a Scratch (Revisión de proyectos hechos en casa)
Taller de Feria:  Realización de proyectos y feria
Reto Scratch: Algoritmos y Codificación Visual en Scratch
Premiación, agradecimiento y Creación del Club de Programadores
Host_info: Prof. de Edumática en la Universidad Ezequiel Zamora (Unellez) adscrito al  Vicerrectorado de Planificación y Desarrollo Social de Barinas, Venezuela. Coordinador del Scratch Day 2018 en Venezuela como "Bitmix {CodeHouse} - Feel Good".

About: Programing games, animations, programs

Если ты тоже так думаешь, то приходи на мероприятие посвященное программированию в среде Scratch от MIT. Мы научим тебя программировать мультики и делать игры.
Опыт программирования не обязателен. От тебя требуется только участие!
Приходите! Будет весело, познавательно и вкусно.
P.S. У нас есть печеньки

About: see here http://kyokuri.org/scratchday2015/

Utah Geek Events wants to get the Kids to start off the summer right! Kids Code Conference is for kids 5+ who are interested in technology and programming. We will be creating games in Scratch, HTML5/JavaScript, Python, and Unity 3D. You can also work with some hardware in our Hardware Lab.

Please bring a laptop, if you can, as these will be hands-on sessions where we are going to build a fun game together! The schedule will list age Suggestions next to each session. We will also have plenty of opportunities for parents to learn about what programs are available for kids that are interested in programming/technology.

*Kids under 10 must be accompanied by an adult. Parking is hard to come by at Neumont so we suggest you Park at City Creek(for a fee), On the street around the location or take Trax. The location is just one block south from City Creek stop.

About: Beginner guide for kids about Scratch for 5 days.

O Scratch Day é uma rede global de eventos que celebra o Scratch — e os jovens que programam e criam com ele. Durante o Scratch Day, crianças e adultos se reúnem para compartilhar projetos e aprender mais uns com os outros.
Este ano, a Escola Superior de Tecnologia juntamente com os acadêmicos do curso de Licenciatura em Computação/Informática, estão organizando pela primeira vez em Manaus – AM o Scratch Day.

Diante desta perspectiva, o Scratch Day Manaus visa discutir as questões sobre o ensino de programação nos diferentes níveis de ensino. Será um momento de interação entre os alunos do curso de Licenciatura em Computação/Informática e a comunidade acadêmica onde serão oferecidas oficinas, palestras e atividades que direcionam os envolvidos para a utilização da linguagem de programação (descomplicada) como recurso que possibilita a criação de histórias interativas, jogos e animações dentro de uma perspectiva multidisciplinar.
Plans: Palestra: É importante o Ensino de Programação na Educação Básica? Profª. Dra. Andréa Mendonça – IFAM Horário: 14:00 as 15:00 Local: Sala D5
Oficina Scratch Responsável: Licenciatura em Computação/Informática Horário: 15:30 as 17:30 Local: Lab. A25
Maratona Scratch Responsável: Profª. Dra. Ellóa Guedes Horário: 15:30 às 18:30 Local: Lab. A16
Mostra de Objetos de Aprendizagem utilizando Scratch Responsável: Licenciatura em Computação /Informática Horário: 17:30 as 18:30 Local: Lab. A16

About: Scratch Day no IFES Piúma-ES, dia 14/05/2016 - 07:00 às 12:00 no Labinfo I do IFES Piúma
Scratch Day é um evento que ocorre mundialmente desde 2008, com o objetivo de reunir diversos scratchers para compartilharem experiências e materiais sobre o Scratch (https://scratch.mit.edu/).
Neste ano, a data oficial do evento é dia 14 de maio, e no mundo, mais de 400 instituições realizarão o evento.
Links com informações + página de inscrição
http://day.scratch.mit.edu/events/893/
http://goo.gl/forms/ebs5nqyegI
Sobre o Scratch:
Com o Scratch, você pode programar seus próprios jogos, animações e histórias interativas — e compartilhar suas criações com outras pessoas na comunidade on-line.
O Scratch ajuda jovens a aprender a pensar de forma criativa, a raciocinar de forma sistemática e a trabalhar colaborativamente — habilidades essenciais para a vida no século XXI.
O Scratch é um projeto do grupo Lifelong Kindergarten no Media Lab do MIT. Ele é fornecido gratuitamente.
-Evento livre
-Haverá certificado de participação (pdf)
Host_info: Professor and Researcher at IFES Piúma-ES

Concurso Scratch

El #ScratchDayBogota nace en 2015 como una iniciativa para promover, motivar, crear, colaborar, incentivar y reaprender, y mas allá de esto generar y fortalecer redes entre estudiantes, profesores, industria, niños, jóvenes y adultos.

Este día estaremos celebrando el segundo Scratch Day en Bogotá, este evento esta dirigido a aquellos a quienes les gusta saber cómo funcionan las cosas hasta llegar a hacerlas, además te involucra en el mundo de la programación de forma fácil y divertida.
¿quien puede asistir?
jóvenes, adultos y niños desde los 6 años de edad* tienen la posibilidad de compartir este día solo es necesario tener el interés de aprender a programar lúdicamente.
*menores de 18 años deben ir acompañados de un adulto.
Host_info: Licenciado en Diseño Tecnológico de la Universidad Pedagógica Nacional. Actualmente se desempeña como: Director de redes y eventos de ixmatic @funixmatic, Director de la comunidad Scratch Bogota @scratchbogota, Director de la comunidad Scratch Colombia @colombiascratch, Director REDCOLRE @redcolre

About: hello

Co obxectivo de difundir os valores da programación informática entre os rapaces, os seus pais e os seus formadores, o Colexio Profesional de Enxeñaría Técnica en Informática de Galicia (CPETIG) en colaboración coa Xunta de Galicia, a través da AMTEGA, organizará o vindeiro 10 de outubro o evento “Scratch Day” no que os participantes poderán acceder de forma lúdica e divertida ao mundo da programación, tomando conciencia da potencia desta ferramenta como medio de expresión de ideas e vehículo para o emprendemento.
Diríxese fundamentalmente a rapaces e rapazas de entre 7 e 15 anos, que acompañados dun adulto, poderán compartir unha xornada aprendendo e gozando da informática.

A implicación e a concienciación dos pais neste ámbito servirá de apoio para que os rapaces se sintan atraídos cara a programación informática, de xeito que esta actividade organizada polo colexio non sexa unha excepción, senón o principio dun labor a seguir no fogar.

Ademais, de xeito parello, levarase a cabo tamén unha acción formativa en “Scratch” destinada ao profesorado. Esta actividade servirá como formación presencial dentro do programa “Aprendo programando” incluída no Plan Proxecta, dependente da Co

cratch is a computer programming language created by MIT's Lifelong Kindergarten group. Using Scratch, programmers (scratchers) can create animations, videos, games and almost anything that can be created by higher level programming languages. Scratch is designed with learning and education in mind. As young people create and share projects in Scratch, they develop important design and problem-solving skills, learning how to think creatively, reason systematically, and work collaboratively.

Scratch can be used in many different settings: schools, museums, community centers, and homes. It is intended especially for 8- to 16-year-olds, but younger children can work on Scratch projects with their parents or older siblings, and college students use Scratch in some introductory computer science classes. For more information visit the official site at scratch.mit.edu

About: יחחלילח
Evento organizado pelos acadêmicos do curso de Licenciatura em Informática/Computação da Universidade do Estado do Amazonas.
Orientação do Prof. Almir Junior
DSMS Grades 6 & 7 students  in Ms. S's Technology Literacy classroom will get scratching by coding and creating as they celebrate the global SCRATCH day from May 9 - May 13, 2016.
実施プログラム内容
テーマは「大人と子供のScratch」
●スクラッチ体験会/IT講習室/13:45- /14:45-
Scratchを子どもだけでなく、大人も楽しめるということを知ってもらえる体験会。大人も子供も気軽にScratchを体験できます。
パソコンは用意されているので、気軽に参加いただけます。ノートパソコン持ち込み可
13:45- /14:45-の2回実施。各50分程度を予定しています。CoderDojoのメンターがサポートいたします。
当日先着順で参加可能です。（対象年齢：7歳〜大人まで）
●ライトニングトーク/視聴覚室/14:00-
CoderDojoで活躍しているメンバーを中心に好きなテーマで5分程度ずつ、得意のネタをプレゼンテーション。
小学生・中学生から大人までそれぞれのScratchの楽しみ方を紹介します。
登壇者は、引き続き広く募集しています。参加したい方は、是非お問い合わせください。
予定内容：ラズパイローバー作る時のポイントとか苦労話など/Scratchを使ったアート作品の作り方 など
●プログラミング競作/視聴覚室/15:00-
その場でお題を出して、30分程度でScratchでプログラミングしてもらいます。
会場の皆さんの応援を受けながら制作し、最後に発表いたします。
詳細調整中です。
●作品展示＆ゲーム/視聴覚室/13:45-16:00
Scratchを使ったものを中心に電子工作、Scratch作品などを展示・体験できます。
ロボットカーやプロジェクターを使った多人数参加型ゲームを予定しています。
展示作品は引き続き広く募集しています。参加したい方は、是非お問い合わせください。

We welcome girls and boys of all ages to come enjoy the afternoon coding, creating and remixing in Scratch. This is a FREE event and no experience is necessary. Light refreshments will also be served.
Thanks to HCC and the Howard Tech Council for supporting Scratch Day!!

This is the second year in a row that Western Massachusetts will host a Scratch MeetUp for educators in K-12, higher ed. and informal education settings at the Massachusetts Green High Performance Computing Center (MGHPCC). Join the Commonwealth Alliance for Information Technology (CAITE), the Western MA Computer Science Teachers Association, and your colleagues for a day of active learning, networking and networking.
Plans: This meetup will follow the Scratch MeetUp formula.
Networking: meet other educators and explorers
Unconference-style agenda development: build your own agenda, identify internal expertise
Hands-on breakout sessions: identify a tool or topic and get working, get talking
Discussion breakout sessions: share your expertise and hear from other experts
Show & Tell: you have been creating cool stuff, you have heard about cool stuff being created and now you are all in one place to share
Join us for lunch and keep the discussion going

About: **This event is sold out, but you can search for more Scratch Days in your area using the search bar above!
Join the Scratch Team on May 14th at the MIT Media Lab to meet, share, learn, and celebrate Scratch Day with local Scratchers!

Doors will open at 9am for registration, and festivities will run from 10am to 1pm. After an opening ceremony, children and families can choose from a variety of activities: getting started with Scratch, collaborating on community projects, connecting Scratch to the physical world, facepainting with Scratch sprites, testing out new features, extending Scratch knowledge, and more!

All ages are welcome, from newcomers to experienced Scratchers. All participants will have a chance to learn more about Scratch, share projects, and hang out with the Scratch Team. Younger children can join a ScratchJr workshop. Parents and educators are encouraged to participate in activities and join discussions about Scratch.
We can’t wait to celebrate Scratch Day with you on Saturday, May 14th!
Host_info: Scratch is designed and developed by the Lifelong Kindergarten Group (LLK) at the MIT Media Lab. Scratch Day at MIT is hosted and run by members of the Scratch Team, LLK, and local friends of Scratch.
Organization: The Scratch Team at the MIT Media Lab

Event: Scratch Day u Gradskoj knjiznici Zadar
About: Scratch Day je globalna mreža događanja koja promovira Scratch (https://scratch.mit.edu/) i djecu koja kodiraju i stvaraju uz pomoć njega. Tijekom Scratch dana, djeca i odrasli okupljaju se da bi zajedno dijelili znanje i učili jedni od drugih.
Što je Scratch?

Scratch je programski jezik i razvojno okruženje za stvaranje igara, priča, animacija, glazbe i drugih interaktivnih sadržaja na računalu. Ono po čemu je poseban je to što je posebno osmišljen kako bi bio pristupačan i zanimljiv djeci od 7 do 12 godina (ali i mlađima).

Taj besplatni program razvijen je na poznatom američkom sveučilištu MIT. Ideja je potaknuti djecu da istražuju, smišljaju i ostvaruju svoje zamisli, koje zatim mogu pokazati i dijeliti s drugima putem interneta, usput usvajajući osnove programiranja, matematike, vizualnog i interaktivnog dizajna.

Programiranje u Scratchu potpuno je vizualno. Djeca pišu programe tako što slažu gotove blokove u veće konstrukcije. Tu su svi osnovni elementi koji su od prije poznati iz ostalih programskih jezika: ako–onda grananja, petlje, operatori, varijable – samo što su u ovom slučaju programi pregledniji, na hrvatskom, i ne zahtijevaju učenje učenje posebne sintakse.
Plans: Scratch radionice za osnovnoškolce u info učionici Gradske knjižnice
Scratch Jr radionice za djecu vrtićke dobi na iPad tabletima na dječjem odjelu Gradske knjižnice

About: Приглашаем всех желающих принять участие в конкурсе. К участию в конкурсе допускаются разработанные в среде Scratch проекты по теме: "Литературная страна - 2016". Проект должен быть создан по мотивам литературного произведения.
Номинации конкурса:
• анимированная история (мультфильм)
проект в форме видеоролика или презентации, предназначенный исключительно для просмотра и не требующий активных действий со стороны зрителя
• интерактивная игра

проект с нелинейной структурой, ход которого зависит от выбора зрителя, т. е. объекты способны реагировать на нажатие или наведение мыши, в зависимости от действия зрителя происходит то или иное событие и т. д.

About: Scratch Day is a global network of events that celebrates Scratch — and the young people who code and create with it. During Scratch Day, kids and adults gather to share projects and learn from one another.
This year’s Scratch Day is May 14, 2016. The Sam Fore, Jr. Public Library will be a host site for this event. Participants will learn how to use Scratch to program Sprites to follow various commands.
Plans: We will begin with a short introduction to Scratch and explain how to set up your own account. Then you will have time to play with Scratch and create a project or two. At the end, there will be time to share what you did with others.

About: Come join us for the 3rd annual Scratch Day at Henry M. Gunn High School! This free event is open to middle schoolers* from around the Bay Area. No prior experience is needed, and we have computers for you to use.
The event is in room N-215, the Gunn computer lab. You can find a campus map here: http://gunn.pausd.org/campus-map (The N building is the only 2-story building, and it's next to the football field).
*Elementary school students, check out the nearby Scratch Day at Barron Park's Maker Space: http://bit.ly/24cCyTF
Plans: Participants will learn how to make simple games with Scratch, then spend some time building and sharing their own projects.

About: O Centro Educacional Pioneiro promoverá o Scratch Day pelo terceiro ano consecutivo! Acreditamos na filosofia do evento, no qual crianças e adultos se reúnem para compartilhar projetos e aprender juntos. Por isso, você é nosso convidado para participar deste evento.
Plans: 09h10 - Início das apresentações dos alunos: 4º ano: Projeto de História do Brasil: Indígenas; 5º ano: Projeto de Matemática - Criando jogos matemáticos com Pixel e Star Wars; 6º ano: Projeto do Sistema Solar - Save the Moon; 8º ano: Projeto de Música - Harpa Laser; Alunos voluntários: Alunos Scratchers apresentando suas programações autônomas.

Oficina: Scratch Jr.: Horários: 09h30 às 10h e 11h30 às 12h Local: quadra coberta Público alvo: Crianças à partir de 4 anos, pais e acompanhantes interessados em aprender a programar no Scratch Jr. Sinopse: O ScratchJr é uma linguagem de programação introdutória que permite que as crianças criem suas próprias histórias e jogos interativos. Foi projetado para crianças pequenas, pois não exige domínio da leitura e escrita para sua utilização, porém, encanta pessoas de todas as idades. Inscrição: Não é necessário fazer inscrição, basta entrar e participar. Material sugerido: Tablet com o Scratch Jr. instalado, disponível na Google Play (Android) ou App Store (IOS), aplicativo gratuito.

Oficina: Scratch Iniciação: Horários: 10h30 às 11h e 12h30 às 13h Local: Quadra coberta Público alvo: Todos os interessados em aprender a programar com o Scratch. Sinopse: Nessa oficina será ensinado os comandos básicos do Scratch necessários para criar animações e  jogos digitais. Pessoas de todas as idades podem aprender a programação através dos blocos de encaixe do Scratch. Inscrição: Não é necessário fazer inscrição, basta entrar e participar. Material sugerido: Notebook com Scratch 2.0 ou Scratch 1.4 instalado, disponível gratuitamente em: https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch2download/ (versão 2.0) e https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch_1.4/ (versaõ 1.4).

Oficina: Interagindo com Scratch e Makey Makey: Horário: 10h às 11h15 Local: Laboratório de Tecnologia - 3º andar Público alvo: Todos os interessados em aprender a programar com o Scratch, interagindo com o Makey Makey. Sinopse: O Makey Makey é uma placa de interação física que permite conectar o computador a qualquer material que conduz corrente elétrica, permitindo uma interação divertida dos jogos programados no Scratch com materiais diversos, como: frutas, água, massa de modelar, pessoas, animais, ou o que mais a sua imaginação permitir. Inscrição: Será realizada no local, 15 minutos antes do início da oficina. Limite de 20 pessoas. Material sugerido: Não é necessário trazer nenhum material.

Oficina: Interagindo com o Scratch através do Kinect: Horários: 11h30 às 13h Local: Laboratório de Tecnologia – 3º andar Público alvo: Todos os interessados em aprender a programar com o Scratch, interagindo com o Kinect. Sinopse: Nesta oficina será apresentada a linguagem de programação Scratch em conjunto com o sensor kinect para motivar pais e filhos a descobrirem uma nova forma de interagir com o computador através da criação de jogos interativos. Inscrição: Será realizada no local, 15 minutos antes do início da oficina. Limite de 20 pessoas. Material sugerido: Sensores Kinect com entrada USB ou com cabo adaptador USB.

Oficina: Remixar o meu olhar para o que já existe: Horários: 09h30 às 11h Local: Sala 310 – 3ºandar Público alvo: Todos os interessados em aprender a remixar projetos do Scratch. Sinopse: Será apresentado aos participantes a possibilidade do trabalho com as linguagens de programação a partir da remixagem de jogos e animações já existentes no Scratch, valorizando a produção autoral de terceiros e o trabalho colaborativo. Inscrição: Será realizada no local, 15 minutos antes do início da oficina. Limite de 20 pessoas. Material sugerido: Notebooks disponíveis para conexão à rede wifi.

Oficina: Jogos, Scratch e Webcam, uma mistura bacana: Horários: 11h10 às 12h40 Local: Sala 310 – 3ºandar Público alvo: Todos os interessados em aprender a programar com o Scratch, interagindo com a webcam. Sinopse: Nesta oficina será proposta a construção passo-a-passo de um jogo utilizando as funções e rotinas da lógica de programação e da interação entre máquina e corpo, através de lógica de programação utilizando como estratégia um jogo criado no Scratch e configurado com a webcam. Inscrição:  Será realizada no local, 15 minutos antes do início da oficina. Limite de 20 pessoas. Material sugerido: Notebooks com webcam e com Scratch 2.0 ou Scratch 1.4 instalado, disponível gratuitamente em: https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch2download/ (versão 2.0) e https://scratch.mit.edu/scratch_1.4/ (versaõ 1.4). Arquivos de áudio .mp3 (músicas diversas) e fone de ouvido.
Durante o evento haverá sorteio de livros sobre programação com Scratch.

About: This year our annual Scratch Day event will be hosted within the Hisar Coding Summit. Scratch, an programming environemnt being developed by MIT, incorporates a "drag and drop" styled coding interface. This interface makes Scratch ideal environment for beginners who would like to start learing more about programming. For our Scratch workshop, we kindly request our guests to bring their own laptops with them.
Come join us at the Twin Falls Barnes & Noble to learn about and use Scratch! There will be activities, giveaways, ideas, and fun!

Come play with and pop virtual bubbles created from Scratch on our big video screen.  Once we're tired of the popping,  we'll use Mercer Mayer's book, Bubble Bubble, as inspiration to come up with remix ideas for our own Scratch program.
We'll need Scratch programmers, both experienced and brand new, as well as testers -- that is, kids who like to pop bubbles and make suggestions.  All ages are welcome.
Plans: Start by popping virtual bubbles with your fingers in front of the big video screen
Read Mercer Mayer's book Bubble Bubble together
Discuss remix ideas inspired by the book
Divide into groups to draw, program and test our bubbles remix
Finish up by planning what we could do next.  What more could the bubbles do if we just had more time?!
